alert.note: Alert for Central Aleutians (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 14 at 4:46AM AKST until November 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 45 to 60 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Central Aleutians. * WHEN...From this evening through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Confidence is increasing surrounding a strong low that will continue to move into the Bering into Tuesday. Storm force winds are expected to move into the Central Aleutians late tomorrow evening as the core of strong winds moves east, toward Adak. Hurricane force gusts are a possibility. Winds should begin to slowly diminish Wednesday morning as the storm weakens and moves east.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
